I discovered that AVG is removing the exe file in the 'identity protection' section. There you can exlude it.

This 'error' shows even in the retail version.
I discovered that AVG is removing the exe file in the 'identity protection' section. There you can exlude it.

AVG always gives false positives cause it's a garbage virus detector. If you want a better virus scanner, use avast, it actually works unlike AVG. But anyways, I scanned the .exe with several of mine and it came up clean, runs fine. Okay game, not really my thing.

AVG is a pain in the ass sometimes people. Like Stickans was commenting on, you really need to disable not only your "identity protection" section, but make sure "Resident Shield" is disabled also. Now this is for ALL installs of torrents period! I'll tell you another that "I" had the same shit with...and that's "Brink". You can waste time trying to download from another site, believing the torrent is "corrupted". Chances are it's not, and the Heuristics for the "crack" files are not a shitty "Trojan" or "Virus" either. Pirates treat their Torrent files just like they do their food! Usually people don't fuck with it...So relax you fuckin' newbs.....lol.

Hey guys, I seen a lot of people having issues with the crack, or don't know how to use the crack. I ran across this image to help you guys out.

http://i.imgur.com/Tzgfj.jpg

If you're having a hard time finding the actual files to the game, go to computer> OS C: > Program Files > Faery Legends of Avalon
This is where you will copy the file in the "crack" folder, (in this torrent) and replace it in the Faery Legends of Avalon folder.
